description: This network will develop a comprehensive, validated atlas of the human kidney at single cell resolution open to the entire scientific and clinical community.
name: CZI001KID
title: A Comprehensive Single Cell Atlas of the Human Kidney

description: This project seeks to establish the normal range of immune phenotypic variability — both within and across individuals — and assess contributions from genetics and environment, such as diurnal, seasonal, and reproductive cycles and life experience.
name: CZI021IMM
title: Human Immune Variation Across Genetic Backgrounds, Gender and Time

description: This team will analyze single cells and develop computational tools to build a single cell map of the human liver, combining transcriptomics, spatial organization, and cell-cell interactions across diverse individuals and developmental stages.
name: CZI004LIV
title: A Reference Cell Atlas of Human Liver Diversity Over a Lifespan

description: To identify methods of cell and nuclei isolation that are robust across three tissue storage conditions and a number of tissues, with expression changes between storage conditions and processing for single-cells versus single-nuclei.
name: CZI025LYN
title: Developing Robust Methods to Process Solid Tissues for Single-Cell RNA-sequencing
